revised_title: Identifying Microseismic Activity with Sea Waves: Analyzing Frequency and Meteorological Factors
tldr: This study examines three sets of simultaneous wave and microseism records to identify the relationship between microseismic activity and sea waves. The research finds that microseismic waves from different sources can be distinguished by frequency analysis, and the two-to-one ratio between wave and microseism periods supports the theory that microseisms are produced by wave interference. The findings suggest that microseismic activity at a particular observatory can be caused by multiple sources, including coastal and distant wave interference.
